item.title: Motivation to Write
item.description: For many years I enjoyed reading blogs, but was never brave enough to write one myself. I found the fact that the content becomes obsolete and stuff I write won’t be true anymore (or people will disagree with me) scary. But here I am today, in the VS Code typing in the first lines of what I am hoping will help me clear my head and form my thoughts better. Become more intimate with the world and people who want to tag along.

item.title: Now
item.description: Last update: July 12, 2024, from my home in Lausanne, Switzerland. Current priorities: Prepare and pass the Goethe-Zertifikat B2 in German. Find a new job. Move to the German speaking part of Switzerland.

item.title: Work
item.description: I used to create software. Now I am growing its potential. Leading brands trusted my work Work Experience Customer Success Manager at SpotMe Jan 2021 till Jan 2024 — Lausanne, Switzerland Managed the largest portfolio of contracts value in EMEA as a single CSM ($1.5M) at the time. Mainly a sales role. Managed strategic relationships as an IT vendor with 30+ enterprises. Coordinated with the product, operations, and engineering to ensure SLAs were met and required improvements were delivered.

item.title: Side Projects
item.description: I am driven by improving things around me. Take Me as an Intern 2016 During the 4 months gap between graduating high school and starting of university I wanted to be an intern so I made one-page site describing my skills and how can I contribute to the business. The site made it as #1 on YC Hacker News. Had over 30k visitors in one night and get huge media attention all around the world.

item.title: Education & Awards
item.description: Education The Story High-quality technical education abroad has been my aim for a long time, which is why I left my home country after graduating from the best tech high school in Slovakia (according to the INEKO ranking). Followed by applying for the Ivy League universities. The University of Cambridge, according to rankings, the 4th best university in the world, invited me for interviews where I exceeded their expectations in Computer Science but didn't persuade them with my math skills.
